content: the studio of @ida noack and @morten loefberg is an abundance of visual impressions particularly noteworthy is the beautiful and delicate ceramics which create a soft and tactile contrast to the many paintings and sketches the ceramic works express an organic maritime language of form evoking thoughts of an underwater landscape where jellyfish and corals move in sync with the gentle rhythm of the water the coralina vest is inspired by noack s ceramics in organic shapes coralina is knitted in the round from the bottom up the pattern sections are worked according to charts when the body is worked up to armholes the work is divided into front and back pieces which are then worked back and forth separately the front and back pieces are joined at the shoulders and stitches are picked up along the neckline and armholes for the ribbed edges
